info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 7:24AM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Elkhart, Wabash, western Noble, western Whitley, Kosciusko, eastern Cass, western Lagrange, eastern St. Joseph, eastern Fulton, Miami, eastern Marshall, Cass and western St. Joseph Counties through 815 AM EDT... At 723 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Georgetown to near Mentone to 7 miles south of Logansport. Movement was northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Mishawaka, Niles, Granger, Edwardsburg and Mentone around 730 AM EDT. Elkhart and Simonton Lake around 735 AM EDT. Warsaw, Winona Lake, Cassopolis and Bunker Hill around 740 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Peru, Pierceton, Mexico, North Webster, Marcellus, Wabash, Three Rivers, Ligonier, North Manchester and Albion. This includes Interstate 80 in Indiana between mile markers 80 and 119. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until these storms pass.
